oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On isolated singularities with noninvertible finite endomorphism
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Zhang, Yuchen
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Algebraic Geometry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We prove that if $\phi:(X,0)\to (X,0)$ is a finite endomorphism of an isolated singularity such that $\operatorname{deg}(\phi)\geq 2$ and $\phi$ is \'etale in codimension 1, then $X$ is $\mathbb{Q}$-Gorenstein and log canonical.
Comment: v2. The result is stronger due to a new observation. Several major changes. Comments are welcome
